ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] The first time to group blues.
ygData.msgSnippet: About the group chat thing.... yes, you can filter out unwanted chat and melee hits. It s under Options, then Keyboard, I think. Or maybe not, lol. Can t
ygData.messageBody:
About the group chat thing....

yes, you can filter out unwanted chat and melee hits.
It's under Options, then Keyboard, I think. Or maybe
not, lol. Can't remember right now.

Another thing I do, is create a seperate chat window
just for group chat. Right click on the top of your
chat window where it says Main chat, click new chat
window, then rearrange and resize all your windows
untill you get a setup that you can work with and live
with. I try to keep both my chat boxes at the bottom,
and made a bit smaller so that they both are
side-by-side.

As for the shaman advice, I myself have never played
one. But I do know that they are mostly wanted in
groups for their great buffs and their ability to slow
the mob. Also, if you have a cleric in your group,
shaman are great back-up healers.

--- Edward Fox <family10@...> wrote:
> Folks I need some tips. I grouped for the first time
> ever in the
> camp in the Northern end of Paludal Caverns. I had
> no idea what to
> do so I kept everybody healed. My character is a
> level 23 shaman.
>
> Then I was told that I should be giving everybody
> dex buffs instead.
> So I did. I told everyone that to tell me when they
> needed more
> buffing. Then, after a while, I was told about
> something called a
> gropu channel and that I ought to click "say".
>
> Note that I gathered that while watching text scroll
> up and off my
> screen faster than I could read it. Everytime that a
> mob bealched, I
> got a line of text. Things were very lively.
>
> I'm level 24 now. I figured out that right clicking
> the dialog bar
> will pull a box that will let me filter out
> everything but group
> chat using group-say.
>
> How is a shaman important to a group? What does the
> group need most
> from the shaman? What is a shaman expected to know?
>
> My character is Gunli on the Luclin server.
>
>


=====
